title: Whereas complaint hath often been made to us that divers persons do rudely press and with evil language and blows force their way into our theatres ... at the time of their public representations and actings, without paying the price established ...
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker ...,
notes: At head of page: Charles R.
"Given at our court at Whitehall the second day of February in the twenty sixth year of our reign."
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
